text: Acleris aurichalcana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in South Korea, China (Shensi), Japan and Russia (Amur). The wingspan is about 20 mm. The larvae feed on Tilia japonica, Tilia tuan,Check List of the Tribe Tortricini (Lepidoptera: Tortricidae) in Northeast china, with Two Newly Recorded Species from China Tilia amurensis, Tilia maximowitziana and Lespedeza bicolor.Croesia at funet ==References== Category:Moths described in 1865 aurichalcana Category:Moths of Asia
title: Acleris aurichalcana
